cheatsheet.title: Generating links to your existing data

intro.description:
Here we are going to copy in an existing set of sample data. We aren't going to link to the original set, since we don't want to modify it, or we don't have modify access.
The steps presume that the Debrief Sample data is in the Debrief\DebriefNG folder that is probably in a Programs network share.

item.title: Check Navigator is open
item.description: In the top left hand corner of Debrief you should find the Navigator window. If it isn't there, select Navigator from Debrief's Window/Show View menu.

item.title: Check you have a workspace
item.description: Before you can import the existing data, you need to define a project for your work. This is a parent folder within which your data (or links to your data) is stored. If your Navigator window is empty, you must follow the Generating a project cheat-sheet accessed from the Help/Cheat Sheets menu.

item.title: Prepare to drag in data
item.description:
The sample data is going to be dragged in. In order to do this, the relevant windows both need to be visible at the same time.
So, open Windows Explorer and then arrange your on-screen Windows so that Debrief is also visible. Then, navigate in Windows Explorer so that you can see the sample_data folder. It's in the Debrief/DebriefNG folder.

item.title: Drag in sample data
item.description: Now that you are ready to import, pick up the sample_data folder using your mouse, and drop it into a project in the Navigator window of Debrief. A dialog will open asking you if you wish to Copy files and folders or Link to files and folders. Select the Copy option.
item.onCompletion: Ok, you now have your linked data, and we can move on to analysis.
